content.heading: HTML Forms
paragraphs: An HTML form is used to collect user input, which is often sent to a server for processing.

content.heading: The <form> Element
paragraphs: The HTML <form> element creates a form for user input. It is a container for different types of input elements like text fields, checkboxes, and submit buttons.

content.heading: The <input> Element
paragraphs: The HTML <input> element is the most used form element and can be displayed in various ways depending on the type attribute.

content.heading: Example
The <label> Element
paragraphs: The <label> element defines a label for form elements, improving accessibility. The for attribute of the <label> tag should match the id of the <input> element.

content.heading: Radio Buttons
paragraphs: The <input type="radio"> defines a radio button, allowing the selection of one choice.

content.heading: Example

content.heading: Checkboxes
paragraphs: The <input type="checkbox"> defines a checkbox, allowing the selection of multiple options.

content.heading: Example
The Submit Button
paragraphs: The <input type="submit"> defines a button for submitting the form data.

content.heading: Example
The Name Attribute for <input>
paragraphs: Each input field must have a name attribute to be submitted; otherwise, its value will not be sent.
